meanings.def: a room in which meals are cooked or prepared
examples: We ate at the kitchen table.
He stabbed her with a kitchen knife.
(especially British English) The house has a fully fitted kitchen with custom-built units.
I sat at the kitchen island eating a bowl of cereal.
We handed our trays through the kitchen hatch as we left.

meanings.def: a very large number of things, probably more than is necessary
examples: We seem to take everything but the kitchen sink when we go camping.

meanings.def: used to tell somebody to stop trying to do something if they find it too difficult, especially in order to suggest that they are less able than other people
